title: Team member invitations to sandboxed teams are not invalidated consistently (v2)

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
As per our email conversation on ticket 2527, I am giving you a proof of concept of my claim.

1. I have a sandboxed team in hackerone,named movielee.
2. The manager of that team (@haxorsistz) sends an invite to => haxorsistz@gmail.com
3. The link which I received on email was => https://hackerone.com/invitations/6fbca8af2f861c8174136f97ec51fde6

4. I logged in from another researcher (@geekboy) account and visited the link.Accepted the request.
5. Now I can see that invitation is still live.

So, a member of any team can pass this token to other people and they will be added to the team.I used this token 3 times and it's still live.
vulnerability_information_html:
As per our email conversation on ticket 2527, I am giving you a proof of concept of my claim.

  1. I have a sandboxed team in hackerone,named movielee.
  2. The manager of that team (@haxorsistz) sends an invite to => haxorsistz@gmail.com

  3. The link which I received on email was => https://hackerone.com/invitations/6fbca8af2f861c8174136f97ec51fde6

  4. I logged in from another researcher (@geekboy) account and visited the link.Accepted the request.

  5. Now I can see that invitation is still live.

So, a member of any team can pass this token to other people and they will be added to the team.I used this token 3 times and it's still live.

activities.message:
I have created an unlisted youtube video describing the issue:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pk0mxu25TkA&feature=youtu.be

activities.message: Thanks for reporting this. We've been able to reproduce this and are working on a fix as we speak.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for reporting this. We've been able to reproduce this and are working on a fix as we speak.

activities.message: thanks @rso for clarifying the matter.
activities.markdown_message: thanks @rso for clarifying the matter.

activities.message:
Seems that you resolved and awarded bounty to that original report.But unfortunately the problem still exists.
There are two types of sandboxed program in hackerone.
1. Those previous program,which needed to be approved by hackerone stuff before coming to sandboxed mode.
2. The newer version programs,which requires no action from hackerone stuff before going to sandbox mode.

The problem seems resolved for second category.But still exists in first category.

POC:

Use the following token to be a part of my team.
https://hackerone.com/invitations/d82a11aa0bbc9222a5ff9620a7b35cec

I already used this token twice and still active.Just accept the request from two different ID.Dont reject the invitation,cause rejection destroys the token.

Thanks

activities.message: I just used that invitation using my main account, and it was successful. I then tried to use it on a secondary account, and it did not work (the invitation link returns 404).
activities.markdown_message: I just used that invitation using my main account, and it was successful. I then tried to use it on a secondary account, and it did not work (the invitation link returns 404).

activities.message:
I just checked again and still can use same token multiple time.Same thing happening again.On the resolved ticket,you were not able to reproduce.But after my explanation you were able to reproduce the issue.

https://hackerone.com/invitations/6e9174b5564f832c8d07b23a14734c7a

Try this token again please.
1. login to account a > go to invitation url > accept.
2. login to account b > go to invitation url > accept.

Please watch my youtube video poc on the initial report.

activities.message:
I just tried again, and I was only able to use the invitation one time. :/

In the cases where you are able to get the invitation to work multiple times and when you click the accept button, do you always see a redirect to https://hackerone.com/invitations/<token>/accept and then a 404 page (as shown in your video)?
activities.markdown_message:
I just tried again, and I was only able to use the invitation one time. :/

In the cases where you are able to get the invitation to work multiple times and when you click the accept button, do you always see a redirect to https://hackerone.com/invitations/<token>/accept and then a 404 page (as shown in your video)?

activities.message: I dont know why the token expires for you after one use.Is there any chance that token will not expire if that member was previously on team and then left the team?
activities.markdown_message: I dont know why the token expires for you after one use.Is there any chance that token will not expire if that member was previously on team and then left the team?

activities.message: Is there any way I can share my screen with you? So that I can demonstrate?
activities.markdown_message: Is there any way I can share my screen with you? So that I can demonstrate?

activities.message: Yes, I always see a redirect to https://hackerone.com/invitations/<token>/accept and then I can reuse the token.And that user become a member of the team.
activities.markdown_message: Yes, I always see a redirect to https://hackerone.com/invitations/<token>/accept and then I can reuse the token.And that user become a member of the team.

activities.message: I can do a Google Hangout with you. Does that work? If so, I will send you a hangout request.

activities.message: As per call, reopening this.
activities.markdown_message: As per call, reopening this.

activities.message: Hello @siddiki, we've made some changes so that reusing an invitation in this manner should no longer be possible. Could you check and confirm that the bug is really fixed this time?
activities.markdown_message: Hello @siddiki, we've made some changes so that reusing an invitation in this manner should no longer be possible. Could you check and confirm that the bug is really fixed this time?

@siebejan,
I checked just now.I can assure you that the issue is fully patched in my end.
But still when a new member clicks on accept ,it redirects him to https://hackerone.com/invitations/<token>/accept resulting a 404 error.

activities.message:
That's good to hear, and thank you for responding this quickly!

The 404 error is a functional bug. The security issue here has been addressed, so this bug can now be resolved.
activities.markdown_message:
That's good to hear, and thank you for responding this quickly!

The 404 error is a functional bug. The security issue here has been addressed, so this bug can now be resolved.

additional_data.old_title: Add other people to the team without manager privilege.
additional_data.new_title: Team member invitations to sandboxed teams are not invalidated consistently (v2)

summaries.content:
Due to an issue with accepting an invitation, a user would be added to the team without the invitation being invalidated, causing invitations to be reusable. 

This would occur under certain circumstances in teams that are in sandbox mode.
summaries.content_html:
Due to an issue with accepting an invitation, a user would be added to the team without the invitation being invalidated, causing invitations to be reusable.

This would occur under certain circumstances in teams that are in sandbox mode.
